content.helpText:
Kinklist Editor Help:

SYNTAX (ONLY these prefixes are valid):
# Category Name - Defines a new category (e.g. #Basics)
(Field designation) - Optional field after #-line (e.g. (General))
* Kink Name - Defines a kink entry
? Description - Description of the previous kink
// Comment - Comment line

EXAMPLE (Standard Schema):
#Basics
(General)
* I enjoy working with cisgender people
? I feel comfortable and positive about engaging in hypnosis with cisgender individuals.
* I drop very easily
? I enter trance states quickly and with little resistance, often after minimal induction.

COLOR CODING:
# Categories - Green and bold
() Fields - Blue and italic
* Kinks - Orange/yellow and bold
? Descriptions - Brown/gray and italic
// Comments - Gray and italic

KEYBOARD SHORTCUTS (Monaco Editor):
Ctrl+Space - IntelliSense/Autocomplete
Ctrl+Shift+I - Format
Ctrl+F - Find
Ctrl+H - Find and Replace
Ctrl+G - Go to Line
F1 - Command Palette
Alt+Z - Toggle Word Wrap

SNIPPETS:
- cat: New category
- item: New kink entry
- section: Category with kinks
- template: Complete standard template

TIPS:
- Use empty lines for better readability
- Categories should start with #
- Each kink should have a description with ?
- Only the prefixes shown above are valid

cat.label: cat
cat.documentation: Creates a new category with optional field designation

item.label: item
item.documentation: Creates a new kink entry with description

section.label: section
section.documentation: Creates a complete section with category and multiple kinks

basicSection.label: basic-section
basicSection.documentation: Creates a Basics section based on the standard template

safetySection.label: safety-section
safetySection.documentation: Creates a Safety and Consent section

detailedHelp.syntax:
Kinklist Syntax Overview (ONLY these prefixes are valid):

# Category Name          - Defines a new category (green, bold)
(Field designation)      - Optional field designation after #-line (blue, italic)
* Kink Name              - Kink entry (orange/yellow, bold)
? Description            - Description of the previous kink (brown/gray, italic)
// Comment               - Comment line (gray, italic)

EXAMPLE (Standard Schema):
#Basics
(General)
* I enjoy working with cisgender people
? I feel comfortable and positive about engaging in hypnosis with cisgender individuals.
* I drop very easily
? I enter trance states quickly and with little resistance, often after minimal induction.

// Comment for notes

IMPORTANT: Only the 5 prefixes shown above (#, (), *, ?, //) are valid!
detailedHelp.quickStart:
Quick Start:
1. Start with a category (#Basics)
2. Optionally add a field designation ((General))
3. List kinks with * (* Trust)
4. Add descriptions with ? (? Trust is the foundation...)
5. Use // for comments (// This is a comment)
6. Use snippets for faster work:
   - 'cat' for new category
   - 'item' for new kink
   - 'section' for complete section
   - 'template' for standard template
7. Format your code with Ctrl+Shift+I
8. Insert blocks to quickly create complex content
detailedHelp.keyboardShortcuts:
Keyboard Shortcuts (Monaco Editor):
Ctrl+Space         - Show IntelliSense/Autocomplete
Ctrl+Shift+I       - Format code (important!)
Ctrl+F             - Find
Ctrl+H             - Find and Replace
Ctrl+G             - Go to Line
Ctrl+D             - Select Next Occurrence
Ctrl+L             - Select Line
Ctrl+/             - Toggle Line Comment
Alt+Z              - Toggle Word Wrap
F1                 - Open Command Palette
Ctrl+Enter         - Apply changes and close editor
detailedHelp.advanced:
Advanced Features:
- Snippets: Use integrated code snippets for faster input
- IntelliSense: Ctrl+Space shows suggestions based on context
- Formatting: Ctrl+Shift+I formats the entire document correctly
- Validation: Editor automatically highlights syntax errors
- Standard Template: Use the 'template' snippet for the complete standard schema
- Comments: Use // for notes and structuring
- Valid Syntax Only: Only #, (), *, ?, // prefixes are supported

Tip: Look at the standard template to understand the correct syntax.

fix.title: Fix Start Modal Issue
fix.description: If the start modal (kink selection) doesn't close properly or isn't displayed, you can reset the status with this button:
